posts.title: DREAM JOURNAL
posts.description: There's so much I've been taught in school. But I've learned one thing: how much people deny their need for good stories. A lie, a truth, doesn't really matter. What matters is control. That's the gist: if you hold it, they buy it.

posts.title: UNSPOILED
posts.description: The cotton drifted, unfolding the pristine blue that played a melodic acoustic soundtrack by my ear. The maple leaves rustling beneath my striped pyjamas pants joined the serene tweeting, occupying the main performing slot.

posts.title: SWEET CAVITY
posts.description: Sweet Cavity can be enjoyed as an experimental sweet menu, my attempt to figure out the ultimate etiquette to devour the umami of companionship. The bonbon textures of language and structure serve to pierce, to dip, to scoop, to shovel in unique ways, challenging your poetic pancreas.

posts.title: RAIN CHECK
posts.description: A contemporary theatre play that explores blurred relational boundaries, intergenerational trauma and the murky grey areas of emotional life. It does so with empathy, but not with easy answers.

posts.title: Housekeeping
posts.description: This poem holds the ache of reaching and the calm of knowing. It lives in the gap where human intimacy is invited, where closeness is asked to arrive, yet something never quite reaches completion. The invitation to close the distance remains unfinished, no matter how near two bodies become.

posts.title: FATHER ISSUES
posts.description: Father Issues is an apple pie story about devotion, denial, and the slow violence of what cannot be said. A family of three builds a childhood out of sweetness and ritual, until the sweetness rots day by day and absence takes shape through gradual removal. Told in a slow-cinema rhythm, the story leans on imagery and action over dialogue, letting quiet trauma lay itself out, sometimes even through humour.
